moves.1. d4 e6: I don't know what this is, so I'll just play what feels natural.
moves.2. c4 d6: As I said earlier, I don't know this opening but he seems to be playing a little cautiously.
moves.3. e4: I take advantage and stick another pawn in the center.
moves.3... Nf6 4. Nc3 Nc6 5. Nf3: I think I have a superior center, but can it hold?
moves.5... a5 6. a4 Bd7 7. Bd3 Nb4: I'm not sure what he's trying to do here, but it's a little annoying to have a knight lodged there.
moves.8. Bg5 Be7: Too bad he noticed that I could win his knight with e5 if he didn't block.
moves.9. e5: I decided to play it anyway.
moves.9... Nxd3+ 10. Qxd3: I certainly didn't mind that trade, it brought my queen out.
moves.10... dxe5 11. dxe5 Ng4 12. Bxe7 Qxe7 13: I get rid of the knight
moves.15. O-O-O: I know queenside castling might now have been wise because of the pawn cover being blown off, but this doubles my queen and rook on the open file.
moves.18. Qc2 Bxf3: I almost cried here. Luckily I found a way to win back my piece and not lose anything.
moves.22. fxe6: I miss a better move here
moves.22... Qxe5: But he gives me another chance and this time I see it.
moves.23. Qd1: ! Forks a mate threat and the bishop.
moves.24. Qd8#: MATE! As always, please comment and rate.
